证据片段: Oxide films on zirconium alloys undergo an evolution of their physical properties as they thicken. Initially, on plane surfaces, oxide films less than ~2 μm thick are coherent and essentially free from cracks and pores.

文献ID: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_029_chunk7
证据片段: Alloying element atoms incorporated into such an oxide at the oxide/metal interface will experience an effective oxygen partial pressure close to the equilibrium for the oxidation reaction at that temperature (~10^-65 atm. at 500°C).
